title: Mood and Hot Flashes
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION: Sincere thanks for the story on Dr. Fredi Kronenberg's research on the ''hot flashes'' suffered by many women, some of whom choose not to take estrogen replacement at the cessation of the menses (''Hot Flashes Are Topic for Research and Group Therapy,'' Jan. 12).

title: DELAYED ACTION
description: Hubie Brown's world of basketball is not doing too well. Not only did the Knicks finish the first half of the National Basketball Association season in last place in the Atlantic Division with a 15-26 mark, but the coach's television show, entitled ''Hubie Brown's World of Basketball,'' may not be shown.

title: JERSEY COUNTY FINGERPRINTS PUPILS
description: Union County began fingerprinting schoolchildren today. Concerned about the thousands of children around the country who disappear each year, county officials set up the program to establish a record to help in the search for any missing youngster, and to identify him once found, alive or dead.

title: Nurses in Contract Accord
description: The Health and Hospitals Corporation and the union representing nurses in 16 municipal hospitals announced a tentative contract agreement yesterday. The New York State Nurses Association said an 8 percent pay increase would be retroactive to Sept. 1, 1982, and another 8 percent increase would go into effect on July 1, 1983. The present annual starting rate is $17,590.

title: 1. Pinocchio at Bedtime
description: A parent whose child asks for bedtime stories might try reading from an unusual sort of book that is a rag doll of Pinocchio. Its ''pages'' are six flip-up aprons on which Pinocchio's adventures are printed. As the pages are turned up, the doll acquires a new face revelant to the story. On the sixth page, Pinocchio loses his long nose and becomes a boy. The doll is priced at $4.50 in the Performing Arts gift shop in Lincoln Center, 140 West 65th Street.

title: BLOCK DRUG CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including a tax credit of $1.9 million due to a change in Britain's tax laws and a gain of $630,000 on the sale of a building

title: EXCERPTS FROM RESPONSE OF DEMOCRATIC LEADERS IN ASSESSING THE ECONOMY
description: Following are excerpts from ''The State of the Union: A Democratic View,'' broadcast tonight by the Democratic National Committee, the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee and the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee:

title: CONSOLIDATED FOODS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
HUTTON, E F, & CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BULGARIAN IN THE POPE INQUIRY: DO I LOOK LIKE A CONSPIRATOR?
description: With indignation, two Bulgarian officials wanted for questioning by an Italian magistrate said they were innocent of any involvement in the shooting of Pope John Paul II.

title: News Analysis
description: In trying to win a production-sharing agreement from his colleagues in OPEC, Saudi Arabia's oil minister, Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani, resorted to shock tactics this week in what seemed to many a risky attempt to reassert his country's role as OPEC's pacesetter.

title: DRAVO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including an extraordinary gain of $6,786,000 from the transfer to another party of a lease...C-Net income

title: 3M OFF
description: The St. Regis Paper Company yesterday reported a substantial loss in the fourth quarter of 1982, compared with a profit the year before. For the full year, however, the large, diversified forestproducts company managed to report a profit, but a weaker one than in 1981.

title: CAUTION: RADIOACTIVE JEWELRY
description: The State Health Department urged New Yorkers yesterday to discard certain types of inexpensive and widely distributed ceramic jewelry and trinkets from Taiwan because tests had found them to be radioactive. It also said it had advised Federal authorities to make the warning nationwide.

title: CONTROL DATA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
HIGH TECHNOLOGY CRUCIAL TO AMERICAN DEFENSE
description: To the Editor:

title: TURK SOUGHT BY ITALY SAYS HE NEVER MET MAN WHO SHOT POPE
description: A Turk wanted by Italian magistrates on suspicion of complicity in the shooting of Pope John Paul II says he has never met the man who shot the Pontiff in 1981.

title: Market Place; A Fast Pace At the Amex
description: PENSION funds and other cash-rich institutions are credited with fueling the stock market's huge rally since last summer. On some days, institutions account for 70 percent of all volume on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: BIG 3 AUTO SALES RISE BY 10.5%
description: The Big Three domestic auto manufacturers reported today that car sales in the mid-January selling period rose 10.5 percent from the comparable 1982 period, continuing a steady rise in sales from the depressed levels of a year ago.

title: Accountant Is Arrested In Insider Trading Case
description: A Seattle accountant who had been charged with making an illegal $1.1 million profit by trading on insider information about the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation's plans to buy the Santa Fe International Corporation has been arrested on charges of disobeying a court order freezing his assets.

title: EASTERN AIR LINES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including nonoperating gains of $50 million for the qr and $51.3 million for the yr from the sale of tax credits on leasing transactions...C-Net loss...D-Including a nonoperating gain of $29.8 million for the qr and yr

title: SYSCON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
MET OPERA: 'LA BOHEME'
description: LAST season's opulent new production of ''La Boheme'' by Puccini returned to the Metropolitan Opera Monday night. Franco Zeffirelli's sets and staging glowed and glistened as before, but the Met's journeyman cast on this occasion ran a distant second to the visual attractions.

title: BRUSHES IN BEIRUT: U.S.-ISRAELI SIDE ISSUE?
description: United States officials expressed widely varying degrees of concern today about five nonviolent incidents between American marines and Israeli soldiers in Lebanon earlier this month.

title: The U.N. Today; Jan. 26, 1983; GENERAL ASSEMBLY
description: Committee on Palestinian Rights - Meets at 10:30 A.M.

title: Frederick Murphy Hill, 53, A Painter and an Educator
description: Frederick Murphy Hill, for the last 20 years head of the art department of the Buckley School in New York, died of cancer Saturday at his home in Manhattan.

title: PRESIDENT TO SEEK CONTINGENT TAXES
description: President Reagan will seek Congressional authorization of a 1 percent surcharge on individual and corporate incomes and an excise tax on oil of about $5 a barrel should the Federal deficit not fall substantially by mid-1985, White House officials said today.

title: REAGAN ON STAGE
description: President Reagan is down in the polls but he's not down in the dumps. He still reads a State of the Union message better than any President since Franklin Roosevelt, and like Roosevelt he pretends to be faithful to his campaign oratory while modifying it if it doesn't work.

title: 'ZERO' EQUALS SECURITY
description: President Reagan's proposals aimed at limiting intercontinental nuclear weapons, as well as intermediate-range nuclear missiles to be deployed in Europe, have been under severe attack inside and outside his Administration. I believe he should stay his course.

title: CORRECTION
description: A listing on Jan. 17, showing the rankings of doctoral programs as issued by the Conference Board of Associated Research Councils, inadvertently omitted several academic departments. A corrective article appears today on page A10.

title: REAGAN MODIFIES 'NEW FEDERALISM' PLAN
description: The Reagan Administration, having failed in an ambitious effort to transfer dozens of Federal programs to the states last year, has devised a more modest proposal to carry out President Reagan's ''new federalism'' initiative this year.

title: REDSKINS' SUCCESS 'UNREAL' TO MURPHY
description: Five days before Super Bowl XVII, Mark Murphy, the Washington Redskins' free safety, looked out of his room at the luxurious South Coast Plaza Hotel, where the Redskins were staying.

title: FREEPORT-MCMORAN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After nonrecurring charges of $38,646,000 for the qr and $38,723,000 for the yr from the writeoff of costs applicable to three noncommercial U.S. offshore oil and gas properties and income of $21,789,000 for the yr from the sale of assets...C-Net income after a nonrecurring charge of $4,508,000...D-Including income of $8,264,000 from the sale of assets, reorganization expenses of $3,362,000 anda valuation allowance of $4,508,000 for investment in potash assets

title: KNIVES TO DO EXTRA JOBS
description: MUCH has been written in this column about knives because they are probably the most vital tools in a cook's kit. Skimping on the quality of kitchen knives is like buying a car with an inadequate engine.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: * Abbott Laboratories filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission for up to $100 million of 10-year notes and $150 million of 30-year debentures. to be sold through underwriters led by Goldman, Sachs & Co.

title: GOERGE CUKOR, 83, FILM DIRECTOR, DIES
description: George Cukor, a director whose career spanned 53 years and whose films were distinguished by grace, style, taste and unpretentious sophistication, died in Los Angeles on Monday. He was 83 years old.

title: U.S. JUDGE GIVES PRISON SENTENCE TO CUNNINGHAM
description: Patrick J. Cunningham, former Democratic Party chairman of New York State, was sentenced yesterday to three and a half years in prison for conspiring to evade taxes and obstruct justice.

title: U.S. Payment to Swiss
description: The United States Treasury is repaying the last of the money it borrowed in Switzerland in 1979 to defend the dollar. A spokesman for the Swiss National Bank said that $382 million, lent mainly by Swiss banks to the United States Government through a bond issue, would be paid back on schedule Wednesday.

title: WATT APOLOGIZES TO INDIANS FOR ANY 'HURT' FROM SOCIALISM REMARKS
description: Interior Secretary James G. Watt made a surprise appearance today before American Indian leaders to say he was sorry if he ''caused hurt'' when he pointed out the high rates of alcoholism and other social ills among Indians.

title: PERSONAL HEALTH
description: SARAH was 13 when a friend noticed that her back looked crooked, her hips were uneven and her right shoulder blade protruded. Concerned, Sarah mentioned her friend's observation to her parents, who immediately made an appointment with an orthopedic specialist. Diagnosis: scoliosis, an abnormal curvature of the spine that, if left uncorrected in a growing child, can result in an increasingly noticeable physical deformity and sometimes in lung and heart problems as well.

title: FOOD NOTES
description: The Right to Sue

title: CURTICE-BURNS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 24
QUAKER STATE OIL REFINING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Norfolk Profit Declines 44.2%
description: Fourth-quarter earnings of the Norfolk Southern Corporation plunged 44.2 percent, to $80.8 million, or $1.29 a share, from $144.9 million, or $2.34 a share, a year earlier, the company reported yesterday.

title: New Kodak Films
description: The Eastman Kodak Company introduced three new 35-millimeter color films that it said embody new chemical technology allowing improved speed, grain, reproduction and sharpness. The new films - Kodacolor VR 100, 200 and 400 - join the Kodacolor VR 1000, which Kodak announced last year as ''the world's fastest color film.'' Kodak also announced it would add a new model to its line of Disc cameras with a price of less than $57, and a new Kodamatic instant camera with built-in electronic flash, with a list price of $44.95.

title: Bethlehem Mayor Bids P.L.O. and Israel Meet
description: The Mayor of the Israeli-occupied West Bank city of Bethlehem today urged the Palestine Liberation Organization to negotiate with Israel on the basis of President Reagan's peace initiative.

title: LEAR SIEGLER INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BUSINESS FIRES IN WESTWOOD HEIGHTEN FEARS OF MERCHANTS
description: In the third major fire in Westwood's business district in nine months, one store was destroyed Monday night and seven others were damaged.

title: TRANS TECHNOLOGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Letter: On Insurance Bias Women Deserve Pension Equality Too
description: To the Editor:

title: CONDOMINIUMS PLANNED FOR HARLEM BROWNSTONES
description: The Koch administration intends to sell 16 brownstones it owns in Harlem as part of a plan to convert them into 65 to 70 condominium apartments.

title: SPACE TELESCOPE LAUNCHED
description: An infrared telescope satellite that will search for previously unseen stars and other objects was successfully launched tonight, Jet Propulsion Laboratory officials said.

title: Dow Climbs 11.86, to 1,042.03; Rally Follows Sharp Losses
description: Stock prices rose yesterday after two days of sharp declines. The Dow Jones industrial average advanced 11.86 points, to 1,042.03. Analysts attributed the climb mostly to bargain-hunting by institutional accounts and professional traders. They said there was little in the economic news to account for the rise.

title: Burlington Rail
description: The Burlington Northern Railroad said it planned to spend $75 million on a three-year modernization project at its freight-car classification yard here, including $22 million in 1983. The project involves new track and a computerized signal and car-retarder system, a new locomotive shop, roadways and bridges, right-of-way acquisition and utilites.

title: Schering-Plough To Sell DAP Unit
description: The Schering-Plough Corporation said it had agreed to sell its DAP Inc. subsidiary, which produces specialty paints and household sealants, to the Beecham Group P.L.C., a diversified British company, for about $70 million in cash.

title: COMPO INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
CARPENTER TECHNOLOGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SHANKER FOR CHANCELLOR
description: To the Editor:

title: VALMAC INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
COMAIR INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
KEY ITEMS IN BUDGET PLAN
description: The following main elements of the budget for the fiscal year 1984, which President Reagan will submit to Congress Monday, were outlined today in the State of the Union Message and in related briefings by White House aides:

title: KNOX QUITS AS BILLS' COACH OVER CONTRACT
description: Chuck Knox, the coach who rebuilt the Buffalo Bills from National Football League also-rans to divisional champions, resigned today when he could not agree with the owner Ralph Wilson on an extended contract.

title: FLEXIBILITY OF U.S. ON ARMS AFFIRMED
description: Paul H. Nitze, the American negotiator at the medium-range missile talks with the Soviet Union, said today that the United States was ''certainly not locked into'' its zero option proposal calling for the two countries to forgo such weapons altogether.

title: State U. Plans Sports Upgrading
description: The State University of New York could become involved in major college football and basketball under a plan being studied.

title: McLennan 15.8% Higher
description: Marsh & McLennan Companies, a diversified insurance services company, reported that net income advanced 15.8 percent, to $25.6 million, or 74 cents a share, from $22.1 million, or 60 cents a share, in the corresponding quarter a year earlier. Fourth-quarter revenues rose 6.4 percent, to a record $219 million, from $205.8 million in the comparable quarter a year earlier.

title: Poland Says It Will End Rationing of Soap Feb. 1
description: A Government official said today that the rationing of soap and washing powder would be stopped on Feb. 1, but he had little good news about other items.

title: MONSANTO GAINS
description: The Union Carbide Corporation, battered by the weak economy, reported yesterday that net income in the fourth quarter of 1982 plunged by 78.4 percent, while sales dropped 6.2 percent.

title: Getty Sues Kuwait Over Oil Lifting
description: The Getty Oil Company said it had sued Kuwait in a dispute involving oil lifting in a partitioned neutral zone between Kuwait and Saudi Arabia.

title: Bullets Drop Lucas
description: He had skipped a lot of practices, and a couple of games, during the last year and a half. But yesterday, after John Lucas had missed practice once again, he was placed on waivers by the Washington Bullets, who said he would be unconditionally released if he was not picked up by another team within 48 hours. Lucas, a talented guard who joined a rehabilitation program last year after admitting to a cocaine habit, had been absent from ''numerous'' practices this season, a team spokesman said.

title: STRIDE RITE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
INTEL DEFECTORS' NEW COMPANY
description: Last Saturday night in Portland, Ore., a week-old company with just 18 employees held a ''name the company'' party in their new offices. The company not only lacked a name, but also a product and even a business plan.

title: SPOT OIL PRICES DECLINE AGAIN
description: Uncertainty about the impact of OPEC's failure to reach an agreement on production quotas and pricing depressed prices again today on the spot oil market.

title: JERRICO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings have been adjusted to reflect a 5-for-4 stock split declared Jan 25, 1983

title: Lincoln State Car Loans
description: The Lincoln State Bank, a subsidiary of the Dreyfus Corporation, is offering car and truck loans at a below-market rate of 11 percent.

title: World Output Of Steel Drops
description: Sweeping cuts in steel output by Western industrialized countries pushed world crude steel production down by 9.1 percent last year, the International Iron and Steel Institute said today.

title: Careers; Job Outlook In Textile Industry
description: ABASIC industry needs trained personnel. A university seeks s tudents for careers in that industry. And, besides that, s cholarships are available.

title: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 26, 1983; The Economy
description: President Reagan urged Congress to back a broad ''freeze'' in the growth of domestic spending programs. In his second State of the Union Message, Mr. Reagan called for cooperation in reducing the Federal deficit. (Page A1.) He also said contingency taxes, tied to the deficit level in mid-1985, may be needed. Aides said that Congress will be asked to authorize a 1 percent surcharge on individual and corporate incomes and a $5-a-barrel excise tax on oil. (A15.) Democratic leaders in both the House and the Senate, meanwhile, urged that reductions in Social Security benefits be linked to reduced tax cuts for the wealthy. (A1.)

title: GULF STATES UTILITIES CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
GUILFORD MILLS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: 'Rescue' in the Park

title: DEMOCRATS COUNTERATTACK WITH DISH ANTENNA AND INSTANT TAPE
description: Even before Ronald Reagan took to the airwaves in the Capitol this evening, the Democrats had their electronic counterthrust ready in its cassette.

title: SOUTH JERSEY INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Ex-Im Bank in India
description: The United States Export-Import Bank has offered India a loan of about $1.6 billion to finance purchases of American machinery and services, the bank's chairman, William Draper, said today. The 10-year credit, including $600 million for oil exploration, would carry a 10 percent rate. The Indian Government has not yet responded to the offer.

title: Turks Reopen Inquiry Into a Murder by Agca
description: Turkish martial law authorities have ordered new investigations into the murder of a Turkish newspaper editor by Mehmet Ali Agca, the man who shot Pope John Paul II, the semi-official Anatolian news agency reported today.

title: JAPAN SHARPLY PROTESTS SOVIET PROPOSAL ON SHIFTING MISSILES TO ASIA
description: Japan protested to the Soviet Union today about remarks made by the Soviet leader, Yuri V. Andropov, that Moscow might move some of its European-based SS-20 nuclear missiles to Asia.

title: CERTAIN-TEED CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Net loss...C-After a loss of $917,000 from discontinued operations

title: BANTA, GEORGE, CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
HISTORIC REVISION OF CATHOLIC LAWS SIGNED BY PONTIFF
description: Pope John Paul II signed a new code of canon law today that incorporates many of the historic changes brought about by the Second Vatican Council and other reforms that flowed from it.

title: List of Ph.D. Rankings Omitted Some Schools
description: A listing in The New York Times on Jan. 17, showing the rankings of doctoral programs as issued by the Conference Board of Associated Research Councils, inadvertently omitted several academic departments.

title: G.M. and Toyota Still Face Snags
description: The General Motors Corporation and the Toyota Motor Company must settle a few technical matters, including model changes, before they sign a contract to build a front-wheel-drive subcompact in the United States, the Kyodo News Service reported.

title: LIBBEY-OWENS-FORD CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes $560,000 or 6 cents a shr due to liquidation of LIFO inventory quantities and $600,000 or 6 cents a shr from a change in the annual effective tax rate...C-Includes a gain on the sale of oil and gas properties of $1.5 million or 13 cents a shr and $4.1 million or 37 cents a shr from the liquidation of LIFO inventory quantities...D-Includes a gain on the sale of some excess properties of$4.3 million or 39 cents a shr and a charge of $17.2 million for litigation settlement costs

title: PSA Seeks Braniff Landing Rights
description: The vice president of Pacific Southwest Airlines, George Shortley, told a Federal bankruptcy judge the merger between his airline and Braniff Airways Inc. would not take place unless Pacific was granted landing rights.

title: Airborne Freight Ads Use Humility as a Ploy
description: Not only will it be one of the stranger ads ever to come out of an ad agency, but it will also be a fine example of humility as an advertising ploy.

title: Greece Approves Family Law Changes
description: Parliament today unanimously approved sweeping changes in the country's family law, making divorce easier, guaranteeing equality between spouses and ending official discrimination against illegitimate children.

title: SCOTT & FETZER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
VECTOR GRAPHIC INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 4
LEAKY NAVAL STRATEGY
description: Americans can be grateful that their Navy is sturdier than current naval doctrine. For much of the Administration's new naval strategy doesn't hold water.

title: EX-BOSTON OFFICIAL ADMITS ILLEGAL ACTS OF FUND RAISING
description: A former official of the Boston Redevelopment Authority pleaded guilty in Federal District Court today to lying about his role in raising campaign funds for Mayor Kevin H. White from contractors doing business with the city.

title: Comings and Goings
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers have signed Bob Welch, their right-handed starter, to a four-year contract. No terms were announced, but Welch, who made about $215,000 last year, was reportedly asking for $500,000 a season.

title: JEFFERSON BANKSHARES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
FIDELITY OF OKLAHOMA INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Operating earnings; the latest qr results included gains of $3.2 million fromthe sale of securities and a net gain of $519,000 resulting from the purchase of a $4.9 million mortgage on Fidelity's building

title: Webb Purchase
description: The Del E. Webb Corporation said the North Central Development Company, a partnership between it and Harry and Newton Rosenzweig, had bought the Rosenzweig Center of Phoenix in a transaction valued at $50 million. The purchase took place at a trustee's sale as a result of a default by the previous owner. The center includes the Townehouse Hotel, the Del E. Webb headquarters tower, the Greyhound headquarters building, the Continental Bank building, the Greyhound Management Center, parking garages and 15.4 acres of land.

title: LEVER HOUSE LANDMARK UP FOR A VOTE
description: The Board of Estimate will consider tomorrow whether to uphold landmark status for Lever House, the 30-year-old office tower on Park Avenue.

title: CONCERT: A LOT OF FLUTISTS
description: IT was an evening by flute enthusiasts for flute enthusiasts at Avery Fisher Hall on Sunday. Jean-Pierre Rampal played. Julius Baker and Linda Chesis played.

title: TASTEVIN GALA FEELS THE EFFECT OF INFLATION
description: THE world's most prominent society of oenophiles, La Confrerie des Chevaliers du Tastevin, a group whose chief purposes are to drink well, eat well and spare no expense doing so, is experiencing the ravages of inflation. The impact is not so severe as to cause irreparable harm, but it was clearly evident at Monday night's opulent annual induction feast at the Pierre Hotel.

title: UNION OIL OF CALIFORNIA reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DBA SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including tax credits of $4,500 for the qr and $8,800 for the 6 mos

title: News Analysis
description: President Reagan tonight couched his second State of the Union Message in the language of economic realism and bipartisan cooperation but set out a budget strategy that runs the political risk of challenging the Democratic leadership and even some of his Republican allies in Congress. In an effort to reassert leadership on the economy and regain political momentum, the President ticked off a range of program initiatives capped by a call for a ''Federal spending freeze,'' an idea borrowed and adapted from Senator Ernest F. Hollings, the South Carolina Democrat.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Ackerly Inc., a Seattle company, said it had purchased television station KKTV in Colorado Springs from Capitol Broadcasting Co. for $15.5 million in cash and notes.

title: 4 Killed in Explosion At Utah Chemical Plant
description: A fiery explosion killed four workers today and demolished the building where they were working at a complex owned by the Ireco Chemical Company.

title: OUR FEATHERED STATESMEN
description: Mrs. J.T. of East St. Louis, Ill., wants to know if President Reagan has become someone else. Recently, she writes, she saw Interior Secretary James Watt saying on television that the solution to the nation's problems was to ''let Reagan be Reagan.''

title: CONSOLIDATED EDISON CO OF NY INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
STAGE: 'ADAM,' A MUSICAL
description: THE creators of the musical ''Adam,'' at Henry Street Settlement's New Federal Theater, have taken the life of Adam Clayton Powell Jr., one of the most contradictory political figures of our time, and have given it a simplistic storybook treatment. If it were given a hard edge, this could have been an urban American ''Evita,'' or, by emphasizing the flamboyant side of Mr. Powell's character, the show could have challenged ''Fiorello.'' Instead, the evening is a catalogue of missed opportunities - a one-dimensional portrait of a larger-than-life leader.

title: China to Offer Export Credits
description: The Bank of China plans to offer export credits to foreign buyers on a trial basis this year, the New China News Agency said today. Between now and 1985, the bank expects to make low-interest loans totaling $500 million to encourage exports of machinery and ships, the agency said, quoting a report by the Bank of China.

title: Swiss Skier Hurt
description: Peter Mueller, the Swiss skier who leads the overall World Cup Alpine standing, suffered a brain concussion today when he fell during a final downhill practice run. Doctors said he was not on the critical list.

title: HOUGHTON MIFFLIN CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
FIX WITHOUT FEAR: COURSES ON REPAIRS ,
description: For those who don't feel quite confident about picking up a hammer or wrench and tackling household repairs, there are courses around town that will help in overcoming such misgivings. New School for Social Research, 66 West 12th Street.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''I feel like Nathan Hale - I regret that I have but one wife to give to my country's infrastructure.

title: News Analysis
description: The Administration calls its proposal for a three-year tax increase of some $135 billion a standby measure, an insurance policy to be used only if the nation's soaring budget deficits are not substantially reduced by mid-1985. President Reagan proposed the tax increase in his State of the Union address Tuesday night. Under the proposal, the Government would impose a surcharge on personal and corporate incomes and an excise tax of about $5 a barrel on oil. The taxes would not take effect unless a number of conditions were met, including a projected deficit for the fiscal year 1986 exceeding 2 1/2 percent of gross national product.

title: SHELL OIL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BULGARIANS REGRET A TARNISHED IMAGE
description: Bulgarian officials are unhappy and frustrated over what they feel is a growing image of their nation as one that would do the bidding of Moscow in the basest of causes.

title: Arafat Asks Support in P.L.O.  For His Stand on Reagan Plan
description: Yasir Arafat, chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization, conferred with leaders of the P.L.O.'s member groups in Aden today to seek backing for his cautious welcome to an American Middle East peace plan, Palestinian sources said.

title: MARSH SUPERMARKETS reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 8
description: B-Includes a gain of $1,080,000 on the disposition of certain drugstores

title: FIRST CAPITAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-There are no comparable yr-ago figures because the company went public Jan 1,1982

title: Democratic Chairman Predicts Victory in '84
description: The Democratic national chairman, Charles T. Manatt, said today that the failures of the Reagan Administration would drive Republicans from power in 1984, returning the White House and the Senate to the Democrats.

title: BOLT TECHNOLOGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
KOCH 'DISAPPOINTED' BY RESPONSE OF COMMUNITY PANELS ON HOMELESS
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday that in response to his request two months ago that all of New York City's 59 community boards suggest possible sites in their neighborhoods for sheltering homeless people, only six had done so.

title: Product-Oriented Ads Are Planned by Shell
description: With the OPEC ministers recently in Switzerland trying to figure out a way of beating the oil glut in the United States, back home the oil companies are trying to come up with ways of moving the stuff.

title: BYRNE CALCULATION: STREETS MINUS SNOW EQUALS VOTES
description: Mayor Jane M. Byrne is deeply indebted to snow. The 89 inches that fell in the primary campaign in 1979 helped her defeat the incumbent mayor, Michael A. Bilandic.

title: GIARDELLO JR. STEPS INTO RING
description: Paul Tilelli, a 20-year-old junior lightweight from Cherry Hill, N.J., will make his professional boxing debut tonight in a fourround preliminary against a boxer with an 0-2 record. And the promoter is wondering how he's going to fit 2,400 customers in a Philadelphia arena that seats 1,500.

title: Knox to Coach the Seahawks
description: Chuck Knox became head coach of the Seattle Seahawks today, only one day after he resigned as head coach of the Buffalo Bills.

title: CROSS & TRECKER INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
TANDON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 24
description: Shr earnings and shrs outstdng have been adjusted to reflect a 2-for-1 stock split in Aug 1982

description: Patrick Ewing scored 22 points, grabbed 11 rebounds and blocked four shots to lead Georgetown to a 71-48 victory over Seton Hall in a Big East Conference game tonight.

description: Of Swank Inc. Accessories

title: A MASSACRE CHILLS REMOTE, PEACEFUL SURINAME
description: Married, the father of a 3-year-old girl and the president of the local bar association, Kenneth C. Gon,calves lived in a country so small and remote that he liked to say that although this was not the end of the world you could see it from here.

title: MAGIC CHEF INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
HOW DO YOU FEEL WHEN YOUR LOCAL BRONX BUS STOP GOES?
description: In an ever-changing city, one thing that New Yorkers hate to lose is their bus stop. Move it a block or simply switch it to another corner and people get disoriented. After all, bus riders don't pay much attention to street signs - they board in front of a familiar supermarket or get off across from the neighborhood library.

title: BELL CANADA reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including special gains of $2.7 million for the qr and $3.9 million for the yr...C-Including a special gain of $8.7 million

title: Energy Chief In Italy Quits
description: Umberto Colombo, chairman of ENI, the Italian state energy corporation, has resigned and will accept a new appointment as head of the state's nuclear energy unit, Franco Nicolazzi, the Minister for Public Works, said today.

title: SOUTHERN CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes a credit of $23,000,000 for an accounting adjustment

title: MAY NAMES PRESIDENT FOR COAST UNIT
description: The May Department Stores Company said yesterday that it had promoted Judith K. Hofer to be president of its 34-store California unit, a division that generates about $600 million annually in sales.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: German Car Exports
description: West German vehicle exports rose 11 percent in 1982 from 1981, to a record 2.4 million, VDA, a trade association, said today. That was up 50,000 from the previous record set in 1973. Production in the year rose 4 percent, to 4.06 million vehicles.

title: FOREST LABORATORIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including net tax credits of $48,000 for the qr and $83,600 for the 9 mos; shr earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid Jan 13, 1983

title: DANCE: NEW HARLEM THEATER SEASON
description: ON Tuesday night at the City Center, Dance Theater of Harlem got its winter season off to a fine start. How far the company has come in its mastery of traditional classicism was evident in its new production of the ''Pas de Dix'' from ''Raymonda,'' as revived by Frederic Franklin. This excerpt from a ballet originally choreographed in 1898 was introduced to America in 1946 when George Balanchine and Alexandra Danilova staged it for the Ballet Russe de Monte Carlo.

title: In the Empty Nest
description: TO THE HOME EDITOR: Thank you so much for that wonderful column on the empty nest (Hers, Dec. 23). I seem to be surrounded so much by women who say thank God their children are now grown and gone that when I break in and say I loved every minute of my sons' lives at home, there is an uneasy silence.

title: SWEDLOW INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
Dr. Morris Bender, 78; Expert on Brain Tumors
description: Dr. Morris Bender, a neurologist who was among the first to assert that brain tumors could be treated without surgery, died Sunday at Presbyterian Hospital after suffering a heart attack. He was 78 years old and lived in Great Neck, L.I.

title: PSA Loses Bid on Slots
description: The Federal Aviation Administration announced yesterday that it would not turn over to Pacific Southwest Airlines the airport landing slots formerly held by Braniff International, an opinion that was challenged immediately by representatives of the two airlines.

title: HARD TIMES FOR TRUCKERS
description: Once again, troubles are piling up for the trucking industry. Tonnage and revenues are down because of the recession. Scores of truckers, caught in rate wars following deregulation of the industry, have gone bankrupt. Washington has just imposed a new series of tax increases on truck fuel, truck parts, truck use and truck sales.

title: DELAWARE PANEL VOTES TO EXTEND WATER WARNING
description: Rain and snow in the Catskill Mountains have postponed any severe water shortages for New York City, the Delaware River Basin Commission said yesterday, but it extended its drought warning to March 31 because storage levels in three large city reservoirs remained far below normal.

title: MAURICE M. WHEELER
description: Maurice M. Wheeler, former partner in the stock brokerageinvestment concern of Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, died Tuesday at St. Vincent's Hospital.

title: TRADE WITH CUBS
description: The Chicago White Sox ended the suspense over their free-agent compensation selection today by choosing Steve Mura, the St. Louis pitcher, over Ferguson Jenkins, the veteran who pitches for the White Sox's intracity rival, the Cubs.

title: HARRIS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After income from discontinued operations of $2.8 million for the qr and $5.2million for the 6 mos...C-After income from discontinued operations of $5.7 million for the qr and $12.8 million for the 6 mos; the yr-ago results were restated to reflect as discontinued operations the company's printing equipment business

title: News Summary; THURSDAY JANUARY 27, 1983
description: International Evidence linking the Pope's assailant and several Bulgarians who were in Rome before the assassination attempt in May of 1981, is convincing, according to American officials familiar with developments in the Italian investigation. But the officials said that it had not been proven that the relationship between Mehmet Ali Agca, the Turk convicted of shooting the Pope, and the Bulgarians had anything to do with the shooting. (Page A1, Column 3.) A massacre in Suriname has chilled the tiny South American nation. Last month 15 prominent citizens who were reported to be unhappy with the Government's growing ties with leftist regimes were taken from their beds and killed. The military ruler in Suriname said that the men were arrested for plotting to overthrow the Government on Chritmas Day and were shot while trying to escape. (A1:1-3.)

title: AN ARAB PLAN TO DODGE THE PEACE TABLE
description: To the Editor:

title: GENISCO TECHNOLOGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: A Marquis for Midtown

title: Panel Is Cautioned Over Simulcasting
description: Racing figures warned a legislative panel yesterday on proposals to telecast races to betting parlors, theaters, or other tracks throughout the state. Such telecasts, they said, unless efficiently managed and closely monitored, could permanently cripple the industry.

title: MICRO-ORGANISM IS SUSPECTED AS MAJOR KILLER IN PREGNANCY
description: Researchers today reported the discovery of a micro-organism they believe is linked to toxemia of pregnancy, which may cause the deaths of up to five million expectant mothers and fetuses worldwide each year.

title: No Headline
description: Oilers Tie Maple Leafs at 6-6

title: Merger Set in London
description: Blue Circle Industries P.L.C. and Aberthaw Cement P.L.C. said directors of both companies had unanimously agreed to terms whereby Blue Circle would acquire Aberthaw. The Blue Circle bid values Aberthaw's issued share capital at 26.4 million, or $40.6 million, and is on the basis of either eight Blue Circle common shares for every five Aberthaw shares or one Blue Circle common share and 2.4 in cash for each Aberthaw common share. Blue Circle already owns 1.01 million shares, or 26 percent, of Aberthaw.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Diamond Shamrock Corporation, Dallas, has elected C. Barton Groves and Riley M. Epps corporate vice presidents.

title: France Comes to the Aid Of Its 'New Poor'
description: The Government took steps today to come to the aid of the growing number of homeless and unemployed people described here as the ''new poor.''

title: DIETRICH RESOURCES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
TI-CARO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
'WINDS OF WAR' FANS TV RIVALRIES
description: ''The Winds of Whoopee,'' says Orson Welles, speaking portentously in a 30-second promotional spot now appearing on NBC, is ''a television landmark,'' adding, ''Why spend 18 hours watching someone else's war, when you know how it comes out: we win, and then have to buy all their cars. Watch Steve Martin's 'The Winds of Whoopee.' See it all in one hour on Sunday.''

title: TEXACO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Net income for the latest periods reflect a loss of $81 million for the qr and a gain of $62 million for the yr from foreign currency translations; yr-ago net income figures reflect a loss of 21 million for the qr and a gain of $57 millionfor the yr from discontinued operations

title: CYPRESS SAVINGS ASSN (PLANTATION, FLA) reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
WHERE NEW JERSEY YOUTHS GAMBLE AND DRINK
description: To the Editor:

title: Suit Filed in Crash In Connecticut
description: A Milford woman today filed a $16 million suit against a North Carolina trucking company and one of its drivers who was involved in a crash on Interstate 95 that killed her son and six other people.

title: AMERACE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Net income after losses of $1,545,000 for the qr and $1,835,000 for the yr from discontinued operations

title: AT SAINT LAURENT, TAILORED BY DAY AND SULTRY BY NIGHT
description: Yves Saint Laurent's coatdresses alone would make the season a success, but, of course, there was more, much more. There were tailored suits and slinky dresses and memories of Rita Hayworth in ''Gilda.''

title: CHILTON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings reflect a 100 percent stock divd on Nov 30, 1982

title: Shuttle Hydrogen Leak Source of Investigation
description: Technicians climbed into the space shuttle Challenger's engine compartment today to retrieve sensors designed to pinpoint the source of a stubborn hydrogen leak that has indefinitely delayed the ship's first flight.

title: Topics Bright Ideas; The Long View
description: Fourteen voluntary civic agencies have jointly written Mayor Koch urging him to address New York City's problems with extensive planning instead of ''crisis management.'' We suspect the Mayor wonders how long he could look to the horizon without colliding with an object in his path.

title: Vincent McHugh, 78; Was Poet and Novelist
description: Vincent McHugh, the poet and novelist, died in a hospital here Sunday of respiratory complications. He was 78 years old.

title: Two Poles Land a Light Plane In West Berlin and Ask to Stay
description: Two Poles flew a light plane to Tempelhof airfield here today and said they wanted to stay in the West, the police said.

title: MORE AID FOR FARMS
description: its new payment-in-kind program, which gives farmers Government grain and cotton for letting land lie fallow, and in President Reagan's recent signing of legislation that curbs Presidential power to limit grain sales abroad as a foreign policy weapon, the Administration is belatedly recognizing the plight of American farmers. But a sound agricultural policy requires more - to help farmers financially, to conserve farmland and to restore America's reputation as a reliable international supplier of food.

title: TELESCOPE IN ORBIT TO SURVEY GALAXY
description: The first wide-ranging infrared survey of the galaxy is set to begin soon with a recently launched telescope that should provide a new perspective on stars at the center of the Milky Way and aid astonomers in their search for a tenth planet in the solar system.

title: Article 191496 -- No Title
description: Another disappearance of money -$60,000 this time - was reported yesterday at the defunct Sentry Armored Car Courier Company in the Bronx.

title: AMP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Polish Shipyard Puts Walesa on the Payroll
description: The Lenin Shipyard told Lech Walesa today that he was back on the payroll effective Jan. 17 but could not yet return to his job as an electrician, a spokesman for Mr. Walesa said.

title: CALUMET INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
The Coaches' Corner
description: A day after Chuck Knox quit as coach of the Buffalo Bills in a contract dispute with the Bills' owner, Ralph Wilson, who is also a Detroit businessman, one of Knox's top assistants, Tom Catlin, flew to Detroit to talk to Wilson about taking over the Bills. ... A day after Eddie LeBaron, the general manager of the Atlanta Falcons, flew to New York to interview Joe Walton, the offensive coordinator of the Jets, about replacing Leeman Bennett, Walton flew to Dallas to talk to Lamar Hunt, the owner of the Kansas City Chiefs, about replacing Marv Levy. Walton is widely believed to be the top Atlanta choice, and Kansas City is believed to be leaning toward John Mackovic, an assistant coach for the Dallas Cowboys.

title: TEMPORARY GAINS FOUND IN MULTIPLE SCLEROSIS
description: The first clear demonstrations that medical treatment can halt the progress of multiple sclerosis for a substantial time and even produce improvements in some seriously affected patients were reported yesterday.

title: Topics Bright Ideas City of Light
description: ''Ah,'' we tourists used to say on returning from our 8 days, 7 nights, bkfst-included trips to France, ''if only we could get a decent croissant in New York.'' Now we can.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article Jan. 9 about absenteeism in New York City high schools incorrectly identified Caesar Previdi. He is principal of Theodore Roosevelt High School in the Bronx.

title: Rooting for Jets
description: Rich Caster, the tight end, and Garry Puetz, the offensive tackle, are backup players for the Redskins. Both once played for the Jets, Caster for seven years and Puetz for five and a half.

title: BUSINESS PRODUCTIVITY ROSE 2.7% IN 4th QUARTER
description: Productivity in American business, excluding agriculture, rose 2.7 percent in the last quarter of 1982, as declining output during the recession was more than offset by a reduction in working hours, the Labor Department reported today.

title: MYLAN LABORATORIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
FINANCE BRIEFS
description: * Alaska plans to issue $1 billion of tax-exempt bonds in 1983 and billions of dollars more through the decade, according to Gov. William J. Sheffield.

title: BRIGGS & STRATTON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
GIFTS TO NEEDIEST STRESS ATTENTION TO WORLD'S POOR
description: ''There are many needy cases in my country, Iran, alas now beyond my reach. But I console myself with the thought that needy people are the same the world over. Enclosed is a small donation to your admirable fund.''

title: ALZA CORP reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: B-Including a pretax gain of $5.3 million on the sale of shrs of a unit, a $900,000 expense related to Alza's employee stock ownership plan and $10 million of rev received from Ciba-Geigy as paid up royalties...C-Net loss

title: BAKER INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
S.I. Schoolchildren Stranded 2 Hours
description: About 22,000 public and parochial schoolchildren on Staten Island were stranded yesterday morning when bus drivers refused to work for two hours.

title: No Headline
description: Oil Comments By Arab Aide

title: Freeze in '84 Budget Is Belittled by Carter
description: Former President Jimmy Carter said today that President Reagan's proposals to freeze nonmilitary spending in 1984 in an effort to reduce the Federal deficit would not work.

title: BROWNING-FERRIS INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid Jan 7, 1983

title: Tel Aviv Stocks Tumble
description: Prices on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange continued their weeklong fall today as the value of shares traded rose to a record 3.3 billion shekels, or about $100 million. Apart from bank stocks, all sectors of the market have been hit in the selloff. The declines followed Treasury confirmation that mutual funds would be limited to owning no more than 5 percent of a company's share value against 10 percent previously.

title: KOSS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BY ERNEST HOLSENDOLPH
description: Elizabeth H. Dole, nominated by President Reagan to succeed Drew Lewis as Secretary of Transportation, was warmly received today at a Senate confirmation hearing.

title: NEWMONT MINING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes a gain of $294,556,000 from the sale and exchange of shrs of St Joe Minerals Corp and Conoco Inc

title: Market Place; Hard Times For Insurers
description: THE property-casualty insurance companies experienced turbulence in their profits during 1982, and some analysts do not expect the sun to break through any time soon.

title: NEW YORK FIGHTS U.S. TO EXCLUDE LONGER TRUCKS
description: New York officials said yesterday that they would seek a waiver exempting the city from a Federal law that requires it to permit double-trailer trucks on local roads.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Dolls With a Past

title: HEAD OF GOULD INC. RESHAPES COMPANY
description: William T. Ylvisaker, the 58-year-old chairman and chief executive officer of Gould Inc., announced yesterday that he would relinquish some of his control of the company by reorganizing the maker of hightechnology electronics parts into four separate units, each with its own division head.

title: BROCKWAY INC (NYC) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SHARON SAYS LEBANON POSTS WILL REQUIRE ISRAELI SOLDIERS
description: Defense Minister Ariel Sharon said today that the three warning stations that Israel wanted in southern Lebanon would not be mainly for electronic monitoring, as had been reported, but for more intimate intelligence-gathering by contingents of Israeli soldiers and other personnel familiar with the terrain, the language and the local population.

title: LOUISVILLE CEMENT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
LONG ISLAND LIGHTING CO reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
CELANESE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After a special provision of $39 million for the qr and yr for a Mexican affiliate...C-Net income

title: CUOMO BACKS AID FOR LOCAL SHARE OF MEDICAID COST
description: Governor Cuomo will ask the State Legislature to provide $359 million in Medicaid costs now paid by local governments, including New York City, a key aide to the Governor said today.

title: BRITAIN'S NEW PARTY STRUGGLING TO RECAPTURE GOOD OLD DAYS
description: Shirley Williams, the star of Britain's Social Democratic Party, was pictured in last weekend's newspapers in a carefree moment, walking two dogs along the seashore.

title: Three Lemons for Video Slots
description: George Washington Plunkitt, the scoundrel of Tammany Hall, had a peculiar view of political ethics. ''My party's in power,'' he once said, ''and I'm tipped off, say, that they're going to lay out a new park. I go buy up all the land. Then there's a rush to get my land. Ain't it perfectly honest to make a profit on my investment and foresight?'' Mr. Plunkitt is long gone, but his values apparently survive in Trenton.

title: UAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Net loss...C-After a charge of $16,800,000 for the qr from an income tax provision not previously deemed necessary and a gain of $19,800,000 or 67 cents a shr for the yr from the purchase of outstndg notes

title: Holiday Inns to K.&E.
description: Holiday Inns in Memphis confirmed yesterday the rampant rumors that Kenyon & Eckhardt would, effective immediately, be the ad agency for its $15 million domestic advertising account and would both create and place the ads. The last ad agency, Young & Rubicam, had just been doing the placement in recent months.

title: News Analysis
description: The battle of the wilderness, 1980's style, is over, at least for the time being. Conservationists who sought to block the Reagan Administration from permitting oil and gas exploration and drilling in Federal wilderness areas appear to have prevailed in their war of attrition with Interior Secretary James G. Watt.

title: JORGENSEN, EARLE M, CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CORRECTION
description: A bank earnings table in Business Day on Jan. 25 incorrectly stated the change in net operating earnings of the Security Pacific Corporation. For 1982, operating earnings increased 13 percent from 1981. For 1982's fourth quarter, the increase was 28 percent from the 1981 period.

title: Budapest Police Close A Dissident Center
description: About 100 policemen sealed off a street in central Budapest today and closed down Hungary's center for dissident publishing and distribution activities, dissident sources said in telephone interviews from the Hungarian capital.

title: GENERAL FOODS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After a provision of $12,350,000 for the qr and 9 mos for loss on discontinued operations

title: Manley of Redskins Aims for Big Plays
description: For a 23-year-old defensive end completing only his second season in pro football, Dexter Manley has lofty goals. And lofty heroes, too.

title: ROBBERY SUSPECT FREE ON BAIL IS ACCUSED IN BRONX MURDER
description: A man has been charged with slaying a woman in the Bronx after he was freed on bail in a Manhattan robbery case, apparently over the objection of the Manhattan District Attorney's office.

title: Cutter Repaired on Pacific
description: The crew of a Coast Guard cutter patched up three holes in her hull and headed for Hawaii after being battered by high seas and winds gusting to 100 miles per hour, the Coast Guard said today. Water had poured through the holes when the Planetree, carrying 53 crew members, was 1,000 miles from land. The crew used quick-drying cement and shoring material to patch the holes.

title: Five Hurt in Fire At Barbizon Plaza
description: Five people, including three firefighters, were injured in a fire Tuesday at the Barbizon Plaza Hotel on Central Park South, authorities said.

title: CORPORATE TAX UPSETS REAGAN
description: President Reagan criticized the nation's corporate tax system as ''a myth'' today and questioned whether it would be better to pass on profits directly to stockholders to be taxed in their individual incomes.

title: 2 Arms Buildup Critics Named to House Posts
description: Two critics of the Reagan Administration's military buildup were elected as subcommittee chairmen of the House Armed Services Committee today, giving them more prominent platforms from which to voice their concerns.

title: Morris Visiting His Sick Mother
description: Eugene (Mercury) Morris, the former Miami Dolphin running back who has been sentenced to 20 years for drug trafficking, flew here today from Florida with his wife and baby under guard to visit his mother at St. Francis General Hospital.

title: CANADA BANKER OUT OVER BUSINESS TIES
description: The chairman and chief executive of the Canadian Commercial Bank, the nation's 10th largest, has apparently been forced out because of his close business and personal ties to a Toronto financer now being investigated by the federal and Ontario governments.

title: OWNER PROTECTION ON IMPROVEMENTS
description: IN November 1981 a Brooklyn homeowner hired a local contractor to replace the windows in his two-story house. A contract was signed and a $3,000 down payment made. Now, 14 months and dozens of postponements and suspicious excuses later, the homeowner has yet to see either his windows or the elusive contractor.

title: BISHOPS URGE CRIMINAL JUSTICE CHANGE
description: The bishops of the eight Roman Catholic dioceses in New York State yesterday urged major changes in the state criminal justice system to recognize that imprisonment was ''often an inappropriate response to crimes.''

title: LUKENS STEEL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 25
description: B-Net income; the 1982 results include the oper of Lukens General Ind, formerlyGeneral Steel Ind, for the 9 mos since it was acquired on Mar 31, 1982

title: BRIEFING
description: Paved With Coal

title: Municipal Union Elects Chief
description: Frank Morelli has been elected president of District Council 37 of the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees, which represents more than 100,000 city employees, the union announced yesterday. Mr. Morelli, 48 years old, had been president for seven years of Local 983 of the Motor Vehicle Operators Union.

title: Contraceptive Regulation Facing Court Hearing
description: A Federal judge in New York City ordered the Secretary of Health and Human Services yesterday to answer charges that newly adopted regulations requiring parents be notified when their teen-age children receive prescription contraceptives from federally financed clinics is unconstitutional.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: TWICE TOLD

title: REAGAN STILL SEEKS $41 BILLION ARMS RACE
description: President Reagan's statement that he will propose a five-year program of ''savings'' in military spending will not alter plans to ask for an increase of about $41 billion in military spending authority in the fiscal year 1984, according to Administration and Congressional officials.

title: BALLET BASSEL COMPANY PRESENTS MISS ZERRARA
description: LIKE all 19th-century ballet classics, ''Giselle'' has had its fair share of revisions, some of them even dating from last-minute interpolations at the ballet's very premiere in 1841.

title: BRISTOL-MYERS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SUBATOMIC PARTICLE, KEY TO BASIC FORCES, REPORTED DISCOVERED
description: After a 40-year search that has intrigued physicists around the world, a team of scientists has reported discovery of the elusive ''W'' particle, a key member of the family of subatomic particles that seem to control all matter.

title: Insider Reports
description: The New York and the American stock exchanges issued yesterday their latest reports of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchanges. The reports of changes follow: NEW YORK EXCHANGE

title: I.M.F. STRIKES A BLOW FOR APARTHEID
description: To the Editor:

title: IONA, RUTGERS FALL TO TOP-10 TEAMS
description: Memphis State and Louisville, members of the Metro Conference and ranked fifth and eighth in the nation, respectively, came to Madison Square Garden last night and barely managed to escape with victories against unranked teams.

title: No Headline
description: AROUND THE WORLD

title: Judge Says Union City Must Remove Mayor
description: A Superior Court judge ruled today that Mayor Robert C. Botti of Union City, sentenced Monday to 18 months in prison for his conviction in a bid-rigging scheme, must be removed from office.

title: BAXTER TRAVENOL LABORATORIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
RECITAL: A SALUTE TO GERTRUDE STEIN
description: THERE are poets who have used the English language with grace and suppleness, poets who have used it as an instrument for understanding, or for pointing to what lies beyond understanding, but no poet has communicated the sheer joy of playing with language found in the writings of Gertrude Stein.

title: REGAN SAYS '84 BUDGET INDICATES HIGH JOBLESSNESS IN COMING YEARS
description: In the budget President Reagan will announce Monday, the Administration is projecting that the unemployment rate will not drop below 10 percent until well into 1984. At least through 1988, the Administration expects stable economic growth and an annual inflation rate of less than 5 percent.

title: ANTIQUING IN THE FERTILE GROUNDS OF 4 OUTER BOROUGHS
description: THE romance of the barn sale notwithstanding, major urban centers are the most fertile hunting grounds for artifacts of 19th- and early 20th-century life. The furnishings and fittings of New York's brownstones and prewar apartment buildings are constantly spilling out into local shops.

title: MONTANA POWER CO reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
Dow Declines 4.04 Points, to 1,037.99
description: The stock market finished mixed in slower trading yesterday, reflecting investor concern over the direction of interest rates and several dividend reductions.

title: BELO, A H, CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
KOCH LAUDS HIS RECORD
description: Gordon J. Davis, saying it is ''time to move on,'' has resigned after five years as Commissioner of Parks and Recreation, Mayor Koch announced yesterday.

title: CPT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Bus Driver in Crash Had Speeding File
description: The driver of a Greyhound bus that slammed into a tractor-trailer near Kingston, N.Y., last Friday, killing three people and injuring 22, had been ticketed four times for speeding since 1976, the authorities said today.

title: Cutting Divorce Costs
description: TO THE HOME EDITOR: I read with approval Emily Jane Goodman's article (''With New Law, Divorce Fees Soar,'' Jan. 13) on soaring divorce fees. You serve the public well when you inform them accurately about the effects of the New York equitable distribution statute on legal fees.

title: USAIR reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
KEYSTONE CONSOL INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After a tax credit of $1,342,000

title: PHILIP MORRIS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results for 1981 were restated to reflect a change to F.A.S.B. Statement No 52;the restatement of the 1981 results increased 1981 fourth qr earnings by 8 cents a shr

title: BAIRNCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PENNSYLVANIA POWER & LIGHT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes a credit of $12,381,000 or 23 cents a shr from an accounting change

title: AT STATE, EXASPERATION OVER TALKS WITH ISRAELIS
description: With the Middle East diplomatic efforts virtually at an impasse, the Reagan Administration seems to be drifting into a new round of polemics with Israel.

title: THURSDAY, JANUARY 27, 1983; The Economy
description: The Administration projects unemployment of 10 percent or more through 1984 in the budget it will present next week. The budget also projects stable economic growth, at least through 1988, and an inflation rate of less than 5 percent a year. (Page A1.) The key to the Reagan budget strategy is a bid for a six-month freeze on costof-living increases in Social Security benefits. (A1.) The standby tax increases proposed by the Administration would, by its own projections, very likely have to be imposed. (D1.)

title: Bridge: Norwegians Needed Luck; To Win Deal in Amsterdam
description: One of the world's great tournaments is played each December in Amsterdam. It was founded by Maurits Caransa, a Dutch financier, who had an original concept: Most of the leading teams are commercially sponsored, and this attracts many of Europe's best players.

title: No Headline
description: Ford Is Recalling 1,350 Employees

title: WETTERAU INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
E-SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DeLorean Filing
description: John Z. DeLorean, founder and chairman of the bankrupt DeLorean Motor Company, filed with the United States Bankruptcy Court seeking repayment of more than $700,000 from his old company, a DeLorean attorney said.

title: COMBINED COMPANIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
2 RIGHTS GROUPS GO TO COURT TODAY TO FIGHT FOR A NAME: N.A.A.C.P.
description: Two of the nation's leading civil rights organizations will square off against each other in Federal District Court here Thursday over the right to use the initials ''N.A.A.C.P.''

title: People
description: * William B. Palmer elected executive vice president/creative and George A. Preston, a senior vice president, at Doremus & Company.

title: News Analysis
description: The proposal by Gordon M. Ambach, the New York State Commissioner of Education, to have children enter and leave school at earlier ages is at once both far-reaching and conservative.

title: A NEW LIGHT ON AN OLD COLOR
description: HAVING a white room anywhere takes discipline. Having one in Manhattan takes conviction. Even so, this is a city where it is easy to crave a white room. White implies fresh and clean. New York, people like to point out, is neither.

title: News Analysis
description: At the heart of President Reagan's strategy for the 1984 budget is his most ambitious assault yet on the automatic, inflation-driven growth of large programs with guaranteed benefits that have helped push Federal deficits into the $200 billion range.

title: Tesoro Agreement
description: The Tesoro Petroleum Corporation of San Antonio said it had agreed with the McMoran Oil and Gas company, a unit of Freeport-McMoran Inc., on a domestic exploration program for oil and gas. Tesoro said that it would pay McMoran about $33 million for a 25 percent share of McMoran's projects in the Gulf Coast and Anadarko Basin of Oklahoma, and that it would spend an additional $30 million to $35 million for exploration costs on these leases. About 100 exploratory wells are to be drilled during the next 18 to 20 months.

title: VERMONT RESEARCH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
LEARNING THE ART OF INFANT MASSAGE
description: ''AND up ... and down -straighten those legs,'' a voice called out. To a passerby, the staccato instructions coming recently from a basement room at Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn suggested that an adult exercise class was in session.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Sports Pages yesterday in a game between the New Jersey Nets and the Houston Rockets gave the final score incorrectly. The Rockets won by 114-111.

title: U.S. AIDES CAUTIOUS ON POPE SHOOTING
description: The following article is based on reporting by Philip Taubman and Leslie H. Gelb and was written by Mr. Taubman.

title: BUTLER MANUFACTURING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including income of $2,950,000 from discontinued operations; yr-ago results have been restated to reflect the adoption of F.A.S.B. Statement No 52

title: DAY'S WORK FOR 75 IS AN INVESTOR'S NIGHTMARE
description: The state unemployment office saw the opportunity to put 75 men to work demolishing a house for $5 an hour. Times being what they are, the day laborers jumped at the chance for work, and they did a good job. Nothing of the house was left standing.

title: Times Mirror Wins a Ruling
description: A Superior Court judge ruled that the Times Mirror Company may retain both The Hartford Courant and its cable television franchises in the Hartford and Meriden areas.

title: CITY MANAGER LAUDED FOR ROLE IN CALMING MIAMI
description: When the fatal police shooting of a black man touched off sporadic street violence in the Overtown area recently, there was widespread fear that the disturbances might turn into a full-blown riot.

title: TEXAS NURSING HOME FACING MURDER CHARGES IN 8 DEATHS
description: A state court today voided a plea agreement involving a nursing home where eight patients died, setting the stage for possible new murder indictments against the corporation that runs the home.

title: HOW DEBUSSY DEFUSED WAGNER IN HIS 'PELLEAS'
description: LAST Saturday, the Metropolitan Opera performed what may be the most successful of all Wagnerian operas. Wagner did not write it, nor is it even by a German. It was Claude Debussy's ''Pelleas et Melisande.''

title: QUAKER OATS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $300,000 for the qr and $1,200,000 for the 6 mos

title: POPE SAYS NEW LAWS SERVE ORDER AND RIGHTS
description: The new code of canon law is a necessary instrument for order and a guarantee of individual rights inside the Roman Catholic Church, Pope John Paul II said today in a decree proclaiming the new code, which was released by the Vatican.

title: CHORUS: MUSICA SACRA AT FISHER HALL
description: Agood case for the variety and richness of 20th-century choral music was made at Avery Fisher Hall Wednesday night when Musica Sacra, led by Richard Westenburg, performed works by four vastly different composers - Stravinsky, Poulenc, Khatchaturian and Bernstein. The program was devoted to hymns of praise, Stravinsky being represented by the ''Symphony of Psalms,'' Bernstein by his ''Chichester Psalms,'' Poulenc by ''Gloria'' and Khatchaturian by his ''Ode to Joy,'' a hymn of praise to ''the brotherhood of man'' and to ''Moscow the beautiful.''

title: VARIAN ASSOCIATES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes a nonrecurring gain of $2,858,000 or 30 cents a shr from the sale ofVarian's 18 percent interest in Benson Sa

title:
HELPFUL HARDWARE;
CLOSET CONVENIENCES
description: VERSATILITY is the key to a new closet system. Based on designs patented by Closet Systems Corporation, it has a ''universal arm'' consisting of a wooden bar with a series of movable steel arms, each of which can hold two hangers.

title: THE WANDERINGS OF A RUNNING BACK
description: COSTA MESA, Calif. T he games were played at St. Bernard High School in Montville, Conn., and the players were paid afterward in cash, $50 each. Of course, there was more money for the playoffs. The Eastern Connecticut Sea Raiders each received $100 for a playoff game in 1978, which is a mere $35,900 less than each winning player will receive for the Super Bowl game Sunday.

title: KEY TO IMPROVEMENT IN AGRICULTURAL EUROPE
description: To the Editor:

title: LOUISIANA'S GREAT WATER SCARE FADES
description: In Hammond, which calls itself the crossroads of the Sun Belt and, when the neighboring town of Ponchatoula is not paying attention, ''the strawberry capital of America,'' there were some strange events this week.

title: SELF-EMPLOY PENALTY
description: To the Editor:

title: 3 L.S.U. PLAYERS FAIL COURSES
description: Three defensive players on Louisiana State's football team, which played in the Orange Bowl on New Year's Day, have left school because of academic deficiency, Athletic Director Bob Brodhead said today.

title: AT HOME ABROAD; THE HARMLESS PEOPLE
description: The high veld 80 miles from Johannesburg is a vast open plain, the rich fields planted in corn and beans and sunflowers. Nestled against a hill, out of sight from the main road, is a village of 2,000 people, with a whitewashed church on the hill above.

title: Lukewarm Support For Reagan
description: Business and financial executives interviewed yesterday said they agreed with President Reagan's view, delivered Tuesday night in his State of the Union Message, that the economy is ''on the mend.''

title: Midwinter Myth
description: Maybe it's because he is 26 years old and has been playing in the big leagues for only two seasons, but Mookie Wilson of the Mets shot a few holes in one of baseball's midwinter myths during a visit to Shea Stadium.

title: ALLIS-CHALMERS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BETHLEHEM STEEL 4th-QUARTER LOSS HUGE
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation yesterday reported a loss of $1.15 billion for last year's fourth quarter, apparently the biggest threemonth loss any American company has ever had.

title: G.M. Adding Shift
description: The General Motors Corporation will soon recall about 1,000 workers at a car assembly plant in Van Nuys, Calif., Roger Smith, chairman, said in response to an inquiry. He said that he was not sure of the timing of the recall, but that the company planned to start a second work shift at the plant, to increase its production of Pontiac Firebird and Chevrolet Camaro cars.

title: Video Recorder Theft
description: Thieves have stolen 101 video recorders from the main customs processing depot in this central French town, the police said today. Officials estimate that there are about 200,000 video recorders, most of them Japanese, awaiting processing by the customs unit at Poitiers.

title: Applause for Drew
description: He doesn't expect to start playing for another two weeks and he didn't suit up for Tuesday night's game against the San Antonio Spurs, but when John Drew made his first appearance with the Utah Jazz since completing an eight-week drug rehabilitation program, the 8,700 fans in the arena at Salt Lake City apparently wanted to show their support. So after Drew was introduced before the game, they gave him a minute-long standing ovation. ... Billy Cunningham, the coach of the Philadelphia 76ers, will coach the East team in the National Basketball Association's All-Star Game Feb. 13. Pat Riley of the Los Angeles Lakers will coach the West team in the game, which is to be played on the Lakers' home court in Inglewood.

title: WON A RECORD 323 GAMES
description: Bear Bryant died of a heart attack yesterday in Tuscaloosa, Ala., only 37 days after he had retired as head football coach at the University of Alabama with the most victories in college football history.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Comparing Liabilities

title: Q&A
description: Q. Because of a roof leak, the pine paneling in my living room is water-stained. Can I do anything to get rid of this discoloration, or will I have to paint the paneling?

title: Required Reading; Government One
description: Ronald Reagan, Inaugural Address, Jan. 20, 1981: In this present crisis, government is not the solution to our problem; government is the problem. From time to time we've been tempted to believe that society has become too complex to be managed by self-rule, that government by an elite group is superior to government for, by and of the people.

title: Nancy Hanks Tribute
description: President Reagan asked Congress Tuesday to enact a law that would designate the Old Post Office Building and the adjacent plaza as the Nancy Hanks Center in honor of the late chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts. Miss Hanks died of cancer Jan. 7.

title: NEW JERSEY RESOURCES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
ARO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
Harris Unit Sale
description: The Harris Corporation said it expected to complete the sale of its printing equipment business within the next 30 to 60 days for $250 million. A group of investors, including key executives of the business, plan to buy it.

title: Latourette's Wife Charged in Death
description: The wife of the former professional football player Charles Latourette was indicted on a murder charge today in her husband's shooting Dec. 22, an assistant district attorney said.

title: FASHIONABLE FABRICS
description: ARCHITECTS happened to be among her best customers - that gave Jhane Barnes, the 28-year-old fashion designer and Coty Award winner, the idea that a fabric collection for a company that dealt primarily with architects and designers might be a good project with which to get involved. And very involved is just what Miss Barnes proceeded to get in her first fabric collection for Knoll Textiles.

title: No Headline
description: Belgrade Says It Will Repay

title: Segregation Increasing, School Study Indicates
description: Racial segregation in the nation's schools has increased significantly over the past 15 years, according to a private study.

title: U.S. and Angola Aides Hold Talks on Namibia
description: The United States and Angola, whose Marxist Government is not recognized by Washington, today began the first round of talks this year about independence for South-West Africa, the official Angolan press agency reported.

title: THE REGION
description: Charges that Harold Hodes, former Gov. Brendan T. Byrne's chief of staff, was violating the state's ethics code and casino law as a lobbyist for a company seeking a contract to supply video lottery machines were dropped today.

title: CLOROX CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DART & KRAFT INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31

title: U.S. AIR UP
description: Two of the nation's major airlines, United and Trans World, yesterday reported large operating losses for the final quarter of 1982 and for the full year. But their parents managed to show profits.

title: SPORTS PEOPLE
description: Comings and Goings When he announced his retirement from big-time tournaments, Bjorn Borg said he would continue to play exhibition matches. But according to the promoter of an exhibition planned for Norfolk, Va., on Feb. 4, Borg is scheduled to play in only one such exhibition in the United States - the one in Norfolk.

title: DEMOCRATS PICK A STATE SENATOR FOR HOUSE RACE
description: Queens Democratic leaders last night designated State Senator Gary L. Ackerman as the party's nominee for the House of Representatives in a March 1 special election in Queens.

title: THURSDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Washington Bullets vs. Seattle SuperSonics, at Landover, Md. The Bullets, who broke a nine-game losing streak by beating Boston on Monday, have undergone some changes lately, waiving John Lucas, releasing Chubby Cox and acquiring Ricky Sobers from Chicago.

title: U.S. May Grant Aid to Mexico
description: The United States is expected to approve $400 million to $600 million in credit guarantees next month to help finance sales of farm products to Mexico, Administration officials said today.

title: HERS
description: WHAT is the point of a stubbornly recurring memory? Does it prod us to recoup the past in a recuperative way? ''So that's what that meant,'' we say at last when consciousness lays a disentangling finger on a hardened knot of memory.

title: Caterpillar Plans To Lay Off 2,000
description: The Caterpillar Tractor Company said it planned to lay off indefinitely about 1,700 hourly and 300 salaried employees in Joliet beginning Feb. 7 because of the continuing strike by the United Automobile Workers against the maker of heavy machinery.

title: HOW LANSFORD WILSON WRITES WITH ACTORS IN MIND
description: Before plunging in to write ''Angels Fall,'' which has just arrived on Broadway from the Circle Repertory Company in Greenwich Village, Lanford Wilson did what he has done many times before: he began sizing up actors in Circle Rep, where he is one of the writers in residence.

title: PUROLATOR INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Sikhs Resolve to Leave Legislatures in Dispute
description: Sikh leaders in the state of Punjab said today that they had decided to resign from the national and state legislatures after talks here on their religious and political demands ended fruitlessly.

title: Soviet Priest Accused Of Antistate Activities
description: The official press agency Tass reported today that criminal proceedings had been brought against a Roman Catholic priest in Lithuania, the Rev. Alfonsas Svarinskas, for engaging in ''anticonstitutional and antistate activities.''

description: B-Includes a tax credit of $6,869,000 or 76 cents a shr from U.K. tax legislatio

description: The Columbia University business school has received gifts of more than $3 million for enlargement of its administration and classroom building, the university has announced.

title: 3 NEW EXHIBITIONS IN GLASS AND CLAY
description: Three new exhibitions in glass and clay at the American Craft Museum I are congenially, if only tangentially, related. ''Glen Lukens: Pioneer of the Vessel Aesthetic,'' a traveling first retrospective exhibition, was organized by the Fine Arts Gallery of California State University, Los Angeles, and supported by a grant from the National Endowment for the Arts.
